title: Social Genie Is Coming Soon: What We Are Building Next
excerpt: We are actively building Social Genie and preparing rollout. Here is what it will include first, who gets access early, and what to expect next.
content:
## Quick Summary

Social Genie is our next rollout, and it is designed to unify multi-platform social execution in one practical workspace.

## Why Social Genie Exists

Right now, teams still jump between tools for planning, writing, approvals, scheduling, and tracking performance. That fragmentation slows output and lowers quality.

Social Genie is being built to fix that with one connected operating flow.

## What You Can Expect in the First Rollout

Initial focus areas:
- Unified publishing workflow across channels
- Shared calendar and execution visibility
- Better approval and collaboration flow for teams
- Cleaner tracking of what is drafted, approved, and published

## Rollout Plan

We are taking a staged release approach to keep quality high.

- Stage 1: Internal hardening and controlled production checks
- Stage 2: Early access for selected active users
- Stage 3: Broader release once reliability targets are met

## Who Should Care Most

- Agencies handling multiple client pipelines
- Creators running consistent weekly publishing systems
- Teams that want one place for planning and execution

## What Happens Next

As we get closer to release, we will publish:
- Early access criteria
- Detailed feature walkthroughs
- Migration guidance for existing workflows

Social Genie is close, and we are focused on shipping it right, not rushing it out.

faq.question: Is Social Genie already available to all users?
faq.answer: Not yet. It is in active rollout preparation with staged access to ensure release quality and reliability.

faq.question: Will Social Genie replace Tweet Genie and LinkedIn Genie?
faq.answer: It is intended to unify cross-channel operations while preserving the strengths of existing channel-specific workflows.
